movies.title: Late Show
movies.plot: Tele-C, a private German TV station, is in trouble. The audience rating is going down, and program manager Conny Schiffer is desperate. One evening - his best showmaster is interviewing a goat at the moment - he decides to make some changes. Listening to the radio, he hears Hannes Engel, a very creative and special DJ. Unfortunately, Hannes' wife Maria, an actress, has just been thrown off the cast of a major Tele-C TV pic and therefore Conny does not find him in the most receptive mood when trying to hire him for the exact same station. But with the glamorous future Conny promises, Hannes quickly decides to sign - and gets ground up properly in the mills of the German TV industry, just like his wife had forecast.
movies.simplePlot: The program director of a German TV station desperately looks for a new talk master for the Late Show.

biography.bio: Thomas Gottschalk was born on May 18, 1950 in Bamberg, Bavaria, Germany as Thomas Johannes Gottschalk. He is an actor and writer, known for Wetten, dass..? (1981), Gottschalk Live (2012) and Na sowas! (1982). He has been married to Thea Gottschalk since November 11, 1976. They have two children.
biography.name: Thomas Gottschalk

biography.bio: He was born in Neu-Ulm and grew up in Nuertingen, near Stuttgart. Before he became famous as sarcastic TV presenter ("Schmidteinander") he visited the "Schauspielschule Stuttgart" and did some "Kabarett" (e.g. at the "Düsseldorfer Kom(m)oedchen")
biography.name: Harald Schmidt

biography.bio: Veronica Ferres is one of the most famous actresses in Germany, and consistently ranks among the most popular and most successful leading ladies in polls. She has acted in over 30 theatrical feature films and starred in dozens of TV movies, winning most major German film and TV prizes and numerous international awards, including an Emmy 2002 for "The Manns". Ferres is recognized as one of the most influential women in German show biz. Ferres was born in Solingen, Germany, and studied German Literature, Psychology and Drama at the University of Munich before taking up acting. In Germany she had her breakthrough with the title role in the hit comedy "The Super Wife", followed by starring roles in hits such as Oscar nominated "Schtonk!", "Rossini", "Klimt" (alongside John Malkovich) and "Saviours in the Night", making her a household name in Germany. Her TV productions include "The Manns", "Destined to Witness", "The Woman from Checkpoint Charlie", "The Miracle of Berlin", "Marco W. 247 Days in Turkish Prison" and "She Deserved It", among many others. Her awards include the Adolf Grimme Prize, the German Television Prize, the Bavarian Television Prize, the Golden Camera Award and the Bambi Award. In 2013 she shot the international feature "Hector and the Search for Happiness" with Simon Pegg and Jean Reno, and played the main role in the feature film "The Giacomo Variation", again with John Malkovich. Her 13th international production, "The Devil's Violinist", was released theatrically in the fall of 2013. She played the female lead in "Everyman", the traditional opening play of the Salzburg Festival, considered the highest honor in German stagecraft. In 2015, she starred opposite Nic Cage in the thriller, "Pay the Ghost", directed by the Oscar nominated director Uli Edel. In 2016, she'll be seen in the leading role in Werner Herzog's newest film, "Salt and Fire", co-starring Michael Shannon and Gael Garcia Bernal. Veronica is also co-starring in "The Comedian", her 17th English feature film, along with Robert De Niro, Leslie Mann and Danny DeVito. The film is slated to hit theaters in 2017. In 2016 she was filming the German comedy feature film "Unter Deutschen Betten" which was produced by Construction Filmproduction GmbH in co-production with Fox International Production of Germany. Veronica founded her own production company, Construction Filmproduktion GmbH, in 2012.
biography.name: Veronica Ferres

biography.bio: She played in the woman-band "Even Cowgirls get the blues", which also helped her to play her part in the movie Bandits (1997). She wrote most of the songs for the Soundtrack of "Bandits". On 3rd December 2002, her first child, a girl named Angelina Sherri Rose, was born. Father of the child is the American musician Tico Zamora, who lives in Berlin with Jasmin. In 2003, Jasmin will also take part in the tour of German singer Nena (tour is called "Nena & Friends") and she helped Nena to make the English project "Red Nose Day" more popular in Germany.
biography.name: Jasmin Tabatabai

biography.bio: Sabine Orléans was born on March 16, 1960 in Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany as Sabine Schwanz. She is an actress, known for Sun Alley (1999), Late Show (1999) and Siehst du mich? (2005).
biography.name: Sabine Orléans

biography.bio: Dieter Pfaff was born on October 2, 1947 in Dortmund, Germany. He was an actor, known for Der Dicke (2005), Bloch (2002) and Sperling (1996). He was married to Eva Maria Emminger. He died on March 5, 2013 in Hamburg, Germany.
biography.name: Dieter Pfaff

biography.bio: Olli Dittrich was born on November 20, 1956 in Offenbach am Main, Hesse, Germany as Oliver Dittrich. He is an actor and director, known for Dittsche - Das wirklich wahre Leben (2004), Der Wixxer (2004) and König von Deutschland (2013).
biography.name: Olli Dittrich

biography.bio: Otto Schenk was born on June 12, 1930 in Vienna, Austria. He is an actor and director, known for Die Fledermaus (1972), Das Veilchen (1979) and Anatol (1962). He has been married to Renée Michaelis since 1956. They have one child.
biography.name: Otto Schenk

biography.bio: Karl Markovics was born on August 29, 1963 in Vienna, Austria. He is an actor and director, known for The Grand Budapest Hotel (2014), The Counterfeiters (2007) and Unknown (2011). He is married to Stephanie Taussig. They have two children.
biography.name: Karl Markovics

biography.bio: Jürgen Tarrach was born on December 17, 1960 in Geilenkirchen, Germany. He is an actor, known for Casino Royale (2006), The Reader (2008) and Die Musterknaben (1997).
biography.name: Jürgen Tarrach

biography.bio: Andrea Sawatzki was born on February 23, 1963 in Kochel am See, Bavaria, Germany. She is an actress and writer, known for The Experiment (2001), Tatort (1970) and L'école de l'amour (2003).
biography.name: Andrea Sawatzki

biography.bio: Urs Hefti was born on July 20, 1944 in Klosters, Grisons, Switzerland. He was an actor, known for Her Second Chance (2006), Late Show (1999) and Les anges de fer (1981). He died on January 20, 2008 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Urs Hefti

biography.bio: Martin Armknecht was born on February 21, 1962 in Düsseldorf, Germany. He is an actor and producer, known for Abbuzze! Der Badesalz Film (1996), Lindenstraße (1985) and Maybe... Maybe Not (1994).
biography.name: Martin Armknecht

biography.bio: Markus Majowski was born on April 29, 1964 in West Berlin, West Germany. He is an actor, known for Enemy at the Gates (2001), Seven Dwarfs (2004) and Rossini (1997). He has been married to Barbara Schilling since September 22, 2000. They have one child.
biography.name: Markus Majowski

biography.bio: Andreas Kunze was born on August 22, 1952 in Bremen, Germany. He was an actor, known for Le cirque ultime (1994), Le cabinet du docteur Hasenbein (1997) and Texas, Doc Snyder tient le monde en haleine (1993). He died on April 8, 2010 in Essen, Germany.
biography.name: Andreas Kunze

categories.category: Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role (Beste darstellerische Leistung - Weibliche Nebenrolle)
